page.title: 01Setting the Scene.
page.content: Long Lawford village is surrounded by fields of mainly barley,rape,hay and rough grazing.Dotted about in these fields are many different breeds of cattle sheep and other animals.There is a main road (A428) which by-passes the main part of the village. Scattered throughout the area are quite a few ponds,mostly situated in corners of fields providing water for livestock and for irrigation.There are only a few fields which have not been sprayed with pesticides and so there are few meadows with original wild flowers in them. There are three railway lines running around the village, one used by Rugby Cement Company the other two being the main lines between London,Birmingham and Manchester.Close by flows the River Avon.- A rural setting close to the busy Midland town of Rugby.
